abstract: The networking equipment maker Cisco Systems said Tuesday it would buy privately-held BroadWare Technologies, a provider of Internet-based video surveillance software. Financial terms were not disclosed. The company said BroadWare’s software allows users to monitor, manage, record and store audio and video online, and helps customers gain access to live and recorded surveillance video for faster investigation response.
lead_paragraph: The networking equipment maker Cisco Systems said Tuesday it would buy privately-held BroadWare Technologies, a provider of Internet-based video surveillance software. Financial terms were not disclosed. The company said BroadWare’s software allows users to monitor, manage, record and store audio and video online, and helps customers gain access to live and recorded surveillance video for faster investigation response.

headline.main: Cisco Spies Deal in Surveillance Software Maker
